resources.string:
Swipe down from the home screen to show favorites, and upwards to hide them. 
 
Swipe up to show all apps if the favorites panel is hidden.
Swipe down from the top of it to return to the home screen. 
 
The button below the favorites panel opens the launcher menu. 
 
Long-hold an app or folder to access its settings.

Shows a popup of favorites above other apps when you leave the home screen. 
 \If instead it brings you back to the home screen: 
- Press the "clear all" button in "Recent Apps" or 
- Reboot your device 
 
Unintrusively, the notification icon is transparent and of low priority. With some apps having even lower priorities, this may result in empty space in the status bar. 
 
If the Discreet Launcher notification is still there after changing to a different launcher, you can
turn it off in the Discreet Launcher settings.
Refreshing the app list and icons shows a small popup message, it also happens when starting, when an app is added or removed, or if the icon pack is modified.

Use the folder organizer from the menu button or click the title of an open folder to create, rename, favorite it or any app, and/or put an app in it. \nRemoving folders returns all their apps to the main app list.

The search icon lets you find any app, and can be favorited to be available
from the notification, or hidden. \n \nIf there is only one search result, pressing \"Enter\" opens it.
\"@pseudo\" indicates the user who suggested the idea or reported the bug
